content: It is normal to feel discomfort or boredom when starting a meditation practice. The mind is naturally restless and can be difficult to calm and focus. However, with consistent practice, it is possible to cultivate a more stable and concentrated mind. One helpful tip is to start with shorter periods of time and gradually increase the length of your practice as you feel more comfortable. It is also important to find a comfortable and upright seated position, and to choose a quiet and peaceful place to meditate. It can also be helpful to set an intention for your practice, such as cultivating a sense of kindness or compassion towards oneself and others. Remember, the goal of meditation is not to achieve a particular state of mind, but rather to cultivate a clear and open awareness of the present moment. May you find patience and perseverance in your practice.
